com.mashery.util.string

Class ApacheCommonsProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mashery.util.string.ApacheCommonsProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StringUtilsProvider

    public class ApacheCommonsProvider
extends Object
implements StringUtilsProvider
    Restriction
    This class is not intended to be subclassed by clients.

    • Method Detail

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty(String str)
        Description copied from interface: StringUtilsProvider

        Checks if a String is empty ("") or null.

         StringUtils.isEmpty(null)      = true
 StringUtils.isEmpty("")        = true
 StringUtils.isEmpty(" ")       = false
 StringUtils.isEmpty("bob")     = false
 StringUtils.isEmpty("  bob  ") = false
        Specified by:
        isEmpty in interface StringUtilsProvider
        Parameters:
        str - the String to check, may be null
        Returns:
        true if the String is empty or null

        public boolean isNotEmpty(String str)
        Description copied from interface: StringUtilsProvider

        Checks if a String is not empty ("") and not null.

         StringUtils.isNotEmpty(null)      = false
 StringUtils.isNotEmpty("")        = false
 StringUtils.isNotEmpty(" ")       = true
 StringUtils.isNotEmpty("bob")     = true
 StringUtils.isNotEmpty("  bob  ") = true
        Specified by:
        isNotEmpty in interface StringUtilsProvider
        Parameters:
        str - the String to check, may be null
        Returns:
        true if the String is not empty and not null

      • split

        public String[] split(String str)
        Description copied from interface: StringUtilsProvider

        Splits the provided text into an array, using whitespace as the separator. Whitespace is defined by Character.isWhitespace(char).

        The separator is not included in the returned String array. Adjacent separators are treated as one separator. For more control over the split use the StrTokenizer class.

        A null input String returns null.

         StringUtils.split(null)       = null
 StringUtils.split("")         = []
 StringUtils.split("abc def")  = ["abc", "def"]
 StringUtils.split("abc  def") = ["abc", "def"]
 StringUtils.split(" abc ")    = ["abc"]
        Specified by:
        split in interface StringUtilsProvider
        Parameters:
        str - the String to parse, may be null
        Returns:
        an array of parsed Strings, null if null String input

      • split

        public String[] split(String str,
             char separatorChar)
        Description copied from interface: StringUtilsProvider

        Splits the provided text into an array, separator specified. This is an alternative to using StringTokenizer.

        The separator is not included in the returned String array. Adjacent separators are treated as one separator. For more control over the split use the StrTokenizer class.

        A null input String returns null.

         StringUtils.split(null, *)         = null
 StringUtils.split("", *)           = []
 StringUtils.split("a.b.c", '.')    = ["a", "b", "c"]
 StringUtils.split("a..b.c", '.')   = ["a", "b", "c"]
 StringUtils.split("a:b:c", '.')    = ["a:b:c"]
 StringUtils.split("a b c", ' ')    = ["a", "b", "c"]
        Specified by:
        split in interface StringUtilsProvider
        Parameters:
        str - the String to parse, may be null
        separatorChar - the character used as the delimiter
        Returns:
        an array of parsed Strings, null if null String input

      • split

        public String[] split(String str,
             String separatorChars)
        Description copied from interface: StringUtilsProvider

        Splits the provided text into an array, separators specified. This is an alternative to using StringTokenizer.

        The separator is not included in the returned String array. Adjacent separators are treated as one separator. For more control over the split use the StrTokenizer class.

        A null input String returns null. A null separatorChars splits on whitespace.

         StringUtils.split(null, *)         = null
 StringUtils.split("", *)           = []
 StringUtils.split("abc def", null) = ["abc", "def"]
 StringUtils.split("abc def", " ")  = ["abc", "def"]
 StringUtils.split("abc  def", " ") = ["abc", "def"]
 StringUtils.split("ab:cd:ef", ":") = ["ab", "cd", "ef"]
        Specified by:
        split in interface StringUtilsProvider
        Parameters:
        str - the String to parse, may be null
        separatorChars - the characters used as the delimiters, null splits on whitespace
        Returns:
        an array of parsed Strings, null if null String input

      • split

        public String[] split(String str,
             String separatorChars,
             int max)
        Description copied from interface: StringUtilsProvider

        Splits the provided text into an array with a maximum length, separators specified.

        The separator is not included in the returned String array. Adjacent separators are treated as one separator.

        A null input String returns null. A null separatorChars splits on whitespace.

        If more than max delimited substrings are found, the last returned string includes all characters after the first max - 1 returned strings (including separator characters).

         StringUtils.split(null, *, *)            = null
 StringUtils.split("", *, *)              = []
 StringUtils.split("ab de fg", null, 0)   = ["ab", "cd", "ef"]
 StringUtils.split("ab   de fg", null, 0) = ["ab", "cd", "ef"]
 StringUtils.split("ab:cd:ef", ":", 0)    = ["ab", "cd", "ef"]
 StringUtils.split("ab:cd:ef", ":", 2)    = ["ab", "cd:ef"]
        Specified by:
        split in interface StringUtilsProvider
        Parameters:
        str - the String to parse, may be null
        separatorChars - the characters used as the delimiters, null splits on whitespace
        max - the maximum number of elements to include in the array. A zero or negative value implies no limit
        Returns:
        an array of parsed Strings, null if null String input

      • trim

        public String trim(String str)
        Description copied from interface: StringUtilsProvider

        Removes control characters (char <= 32) from both ends of this String, handling null by returning null.

        The String is trimmed using String.trim(). Trim removes start and end characters <= 32. To strip whitespace use StringUtilsProvider.strip(String).

        To trim your choice of characters, use the StringUtilsProvider.strip(String, String) methods.

         StringUtils.trim(null)          = null
 StringUtils.trim("")            = ""
 StringUtils.trim("     ")       = ""
 StringUtils.trim("abc")         = "abc"
 StringUtils.trim("    abc    ") = "abc"
        Specified by:
        trim in interface StringUtilsProvider
        Parameters:
        str - the String to be trimmed, may be null
        Returns:
        the trimmed string, null if null String input

      • trimToNull

        public String trimToNull(String str)
        Description copied from interface: StringUtilsProvider

        Removes control characters (char <= 32) from both ends of this String returning null if the String is empty ("") after the trim or if it is null.

        The String is trimmed using String.trim(). Trim removes start and end characters <= 32. To strip whitespace use StringUtilsProvider.stripToNull(String).

         StringUtils.trimToNull(null)          = null
 StringUtils.trimToNull("")            = null
 StringUtils.trimToNull("     ")       = null
 StringUtils.trimToNull("abc")         = "abc"
 StringUtils.trimToNull("    abc    ") = "abc"
        Specified by:
        trimToNull in interface StringUtilsProvider
        Parameters:
        str - the String to be trimmed, may be null
        Returns:
        the trimmed String, null if only chars <= 32, empty or null String input

      • trimToEmpty

        public String trimToEmpty(String str)
        Description copied from interface: StringUtilsProvider

        Removes control characters (char <= 32) from both ends of this String returning an empty String ("") if the String is empty ("") after the trim or if it is null.

        The String is trimmed using String.trim(). Trim removes start and end characters <= 32. To strip whitespace use StringUtilsProvider.stripToEmpty(String).

         StringUtils.trimToEmpty(null)          = ""
 StringUtils.trimToEmpty("")            = ""
 StringUtils.trimToEmpty("     ")       = ""
 StringUtils.trimToEmpty("abc")         = "abc"
 StringUtils.trimToEmpty("    abc    ") = "abc"
        Specified by:
        trimToEmpty in interface StringUtilsProvider
        Parameters:
        str - the String to be trimmed, may be null
        Returns:
        the trimmed String, or an empty String if null input

      • strip

        public String strip(String str)
        Description copied from interface: StringUtilsProvider

        Strips whitespace from the start and end of a String.

        This is similar to StringUtilsProvider.trim(String) but removes whitespace. Whitespace is defined by Character.isWhitespace(char).

        A null input String returns null.

         StringUtils.strip(null)     = null
 StringUtils.strip("")       = ""
 StringUtils.strip("   ")    = ""
 StringUtils.strip("abc")    = "abc"
 StringUtils.strip("  abc")  = "abc"
 StringUtils.strip("abc  ")  = "abc"
 StringUtils.strip(" abc ")  = "abc"
 StringUtils.strip(" ab c ") = "ab c"
        Specified by:
        strip in interface StringUtilsProvider
        Parameters:
        str - the String to remove whitespace from, may be null
        Returns:
        the stripped String, null if null String input

      • stripToNull

        public String stripToNull(String str)
        Description copied from interface: StringUtilsProvider

        Strips whitespace from the start and end of a String returning null if the String is empty ("") after the strip.

        This is similar to StringUtilsProvider.trimToNull(String) but removes whitespace. Whitespace is defined by Character.isWhitespace(char).

         StringUtils.stripToNull(null)     = null
 StringUtils.stripToNull("")       = null
 StringUtils.stripToNull("   ")    = null
 StringUtils.stripToNull("abc")    = "abc"
 StringUtils.stripToNull("  abc")  = "abc"
 StringUtils.stripToNull("abc  ")  = "abc"
 StringUtils.stripToNull(" abc ")  = "abc"
 StringUtils.stripToNull(" ab c ") = "ab c"
        Specified by:
        stripToNull in interface StringUtilsProvider
        Parameters:
        str - the String to be stripped, may be null
        Returns:
        the stripped String, null if whitespace, empty or null String input

      • stripToEmpty

        public String stripToEmpty(String str)
        Description copied from interface: StringUtilsProvider

        Strips whitespace from the start and end of a String returning an empty String if null input.

        This is similar to StringUtilsProvider.trimToEmpty(String) but removes whitespace. Whitespace is defined by Character.isWhitespace(char).

         StringUtils.stripToEmpty(null)     = ""
 StringUtils.stripToEmpty("")       = ""
 StringUtils.stripToEmpty("   ")    = ""
 StringUtils.stripToEmpty("abc")    = "abc"
 StringUtils.stripToEmpty("  abc")  = "abc"
 StringUtils.stripToEmpty("abc  ")  = "abc"
 StringUtils.stripToEmpty(" abc ")  = "abc"
 StringUtils.stripToEmpty(" ab c ") = "ab c"
        Specified by:
        stripToEmpty in interface StringUtilsProvider
        Parameters:
        str - the String to be stripped, may be null
        Returns:
        the trimmed String, or an empty String if null input

        public String reverse(String str)
        Description copied from interface: StringUtilsProvider

        Reverses a String as per StringBuffer.reverse().

        A null String returns null.

         StringUtils.reverse(null)  = null
 StringUtils.reverse("")    = ""
 StringUtils.reverse("bat") = "tab"
        Specified by:
        reverse in interface StringUtilsProvider
        Parameters:
        str - the String to reverse, may be null
        Returns:
        the reversed String, null if null String input

        A null input String returns null.

         StringUtils.lowerCase(null)  = null
 StringUtils.lowerCase("")    = ""
 StringUtils.lowerCase("aBc") = "abc"
        Specified by:
        lowerCase in interface StringUtilsProvider
        Parameters:
        str - the String to lower case, may be null
        Returns:
        the lower cased String, null if null String input

        public String upperCase(String str)
        Description copied from interface: StringUtilsProvider

        Converts a String to upper case as per String.toUpperCase().

        A null input String returns null.

         StringUtils.upperCase(null)  = null
 StringUtils.upperCase("")    = ""
 StringUtils.upperCase("aBc") = "ABC"
        Specified by:
        upperCase in interface StringUtilsProvider
        Parameters:
        str - the String to upper case, may be null
        Returns:
        the upper cased String, null if null String input

      • strip

        public String strip(String str,
           String stripChars)
        Description copied from interface: StringUtilsProvider

        Strips any of a set of characters from the start and end of a String. This is similar to String.trim() but allows the characters to be stripped to be controlled.

        A null input String returns null. An empty string ("") input returns the empty string.

        If the stripChars String is null, whitespace is stripped as defined by Character.isWhitespace(char). Alternatively use StringUtilsProvider.strip(String).

         StringUtils.strip(null, *)          = null
 StringUtils.strip("", *)            = ""
 StringUtils.strip("abc", null)      = "abc"
 StringUtils.strip("  abc", null)    = "abc"
 StringUtils.strip("abc  ", null)    = "abc"
 StringUtils.strip(" abc ", null)    = "abc"
 StringUtils.strip("  abcyx", "xyz") = "  abc"
        Specified by:
        strip in interface StringUtilsProvider
        Parameters:
        str - the String to remove characters from, may be null
        stripChars - the characters to remove, null treated as whitespace
        Returns:
        the stripped String, null if null String input

      • stripStart

        public String stripStart(String str,
                String stripChars)
        Description copied from interface: StringUtilsProvider

        Strips any of a set of characters from the start of a String.

        A null input String returns null. An empty string ("") input returns the empty string.

        If the stripChars String is null, whitespace is stripped as defined by Character.isWhitespace(char).

         StringUtils.stripStart(null, *)          = null
 StringUtils.stripStart("", *)            = ""
 StringUtils.stripStart("abc", "")        = "abc"
 StringUtils.stripStart("abc", null)      = "abc"
 StringUtils.stripStart("  abc", null)    = "abc"
 StringUtils.stripStart("abc  ", null)    = "abc  "
 StringUtils.stripStart(" abc ", null)    = "abc "
 StringUtils.stripStart("yxabc  ", "xyz") = "abc  "
        Specified by:
        stripStart in interface StringUtilsProvider
        Parameters:
        str - the String to remove characters from, may be null
        stripChars - the characters to remove, null treated as whitespace
        Returns:
        the stripped String, null if null String input

        public String stripEnd(String str,
              String stripChars)
        Description copied from interface: StringUtilsProvider

        Strips any of a set of characters from the end of a String.

        A null input String returns null. An empty string ("") input returns the empty string.

        If the stripChars String is null, whitespace is stripped as defined by Character.isWhitespace(char).

         StringUtils.stripEnd(null, *)          = null
 StringUtils.stripEnd("", *)            = ""
 StringUtils.stripEnd("abc", "")        = "abc"
 StringUtils.stripEnd("abc", null)      = "abc"
 StringUtils.stripEnd("  abc", null)    = "  abc"
 StringUtils.stripEnd("abc  ", null)    = "abc"
 StringUtils.stripEnd(" abc ", null)    = " abc"
 StringUtils.stripEnd("  abcyx", "xyz") = "  abc"
        Specified by:
        stripEnd in interface StringUtilsProvider
        Parameters:
        str - the String to remove characters from, may be null
        stripChars - the characters to remove, null treated as whitespace
        Returns:
        the stripped String, null if null String input
